channel.title: The Mongrel's Howl
channel.itunes:subtitle: Eclectic mix of music, news, and commentary.
channel.itunes:author: The Mongrel
channel.itunes:summary: Evolving, eclectic mix of music, news, and opinion emanating from Boston.
channel.description: Evolving, eclectic mix of music, news, and opinion emanating from Boston.

item.title: Thu, January 19, 2006 - A truly aromatic blend of only the finest tunes from far-flung genres!
item.itunes:author: The Mongrel
item.itunes:subtitle: A production of The Dial Communications. TheDial.net--the synthesis you seek
item.itunes:summary: A truly aromatic blend of only the finest tunes from far-flung genres!
item.description: A truly aromatic blend of only the finest tunes from far-flung genres! Buy an awesome new CD and support the Mass. music scene!. Featured music: Jaded Mandolin--"June Apple/Salt Creek", The Andromeda Quartet--"Norwegian Slip", Charlotte Kendrick--"I Get Stupid", Eli Said--"Waverly", Hector on Stilts--"La Dee Da", NBFB--"Police Are Your Friends" and "Deadly Weapon", Sarah Blacker--"Thinking About You", My Little Radio--"Waste Another Night", El Gringo--"Traffic" and "Radiator Coming", Mark Schwaber--"Ghosting", Uncle Billy's Smokehouse--"Quiet Sundays",
item.itunes:keywords: Boston, Massachusetts, indie, music, bands, "Jaded Mandolin", "Mark Schwaber", "The Andromeda Quartet", "Charlotte Kendrick", "Eli Said", "Hector on Stilts", NBFB, "Sarah Blacker", "My Little Radio" "El Gringo", "Uncle Billy's Smokehouse"

item.title: Thu, January 12, 2006 - New Favorite Bands! Holy Crow! Jazz, Reggae, Jam, Industrial, Folk, Blues, MORE!
item.itunes:author: The Mongrel
item.itunes:subtitle: A production of The Dial Communications. TheDial.net--the synthesis you seek
item.itunes:summary: Who do I think I am? Just what do I think I'm doing? Well, it is my show, after all. And there IS so much music to play for you that it's REALLY HARD not to lose control.
item.description: Who do I think I am? Just what do I think I'm doing? Well, it is my show, after all. And there IS so much music to play for you that it's REALLY HARD not to lose control. Featured music: Plumerai--"Illuminata", Meg Hutchinson--"Leonids", Stringtheory--"Saturday", Eulogy XL--"SpeedBall", NBFB--"Deep Analogue" and "Engine Block" [munk]--"Pod People", Topheavy--"Happy Song", Gringo--"The Rest of Me"and "Alabama Moonstruck" Jaded Mandolin--"Old Virginia", Dylan In the Movies--"August Moon", Bees Deluxe--"Blue Jeans Blues",
item.itunes:keywords: Boston, Massachusetts, indie, music, indy, musicians, music, record, label, bands, Plumerai, "Meg Hutchinson", "Stringtheory, "Eulogy XL", NBFB, [munk], Topheavy, "El Gringo", "Jaded Mandolin", "Dylan In the Movies", "Bees Deluxe"

item.itunes:summary: This week, a little longer than expected. Your computer or iPod may experience strech-marks.
item.description: This week, a little longer than expected. Your computer or iPod may experience strech-marks. item.title: Thu, December 29, 2005 - Phenominal Female Leads! Jams that turn you to jelly! And More!
item.itunes:author: The Mongrel
item.itunes:subtitle: The Mongrel casts an ever-widening net to catch great local music.
item.itunes:summary: This week, featured acts with listings at Podshowcome provide an even wider range of styles and sounds.
item.description: This week, featured acts with listings at Podshow.com provide an even wider range of styles and sounds. Also a show-related announcement. Featured music: Capsela--"Centre Street", Meg Hutchinson--"The Crossing", Uncle Billy's Smokehouse--"GOD", Casey Desmond--"The Child", Brunswick--"Letters Never Sent", Era for a Moment--"The Fire", The Blue Vagrants--"Ragweed"

item.title: Mon, December 19, 2005 - Special Holiday BONUS Howl!
item.itunes:author: The Dial Communications
item.itunes:subtitle: The Mongrel sinks his teeth into MUCH great local music.
item.itunes:summary: This week, still no publishing industry news, but WHAT a show we have for you this week! The Mongrel spent a great deal of time digging up the backyard for some truly precious musical treats this week.
item.description: WHAT a show we have for you this week! The Mongrel spent a great deal of time digging up the backyard for some truly precious musical treats this week. No, still no publishing/media news or interviews, but what of that, eh? Plenty of time for work I say. Let's get right into the music! Featured music: Sky Circuit--"Next to Human", HUMANWINE--"Hypodermic Imagery", Bill Champitto, "Circles", Big Daddy and the Accelerators--"Think", Ara Vora--"Zero Return", The Ferns--"Junkie", Shavahawk--"Truth", Ulysses--"Sad Songs", CV BOYS--"Un So Korasaun", Josh Lederman y Los Diablos--"Listen To That Train Whistle Blow", Bob Kramer--"I maybe right, maybe wrong"
item.itunes:keywords: Boston, Massachusetts, indie, music, bands, "Sky Circuit", humanwine, "bill champitto", "big daddy and the accelerators", "ara vora", "the ferns", ulysses, "cv boys", shavahawk, "Josh Lederman y Los Diablos", "Bob Kramer"

item.title: Tue, December 13, 2005 - The Mongrel's Howl Gets an echo!
item.itunes:author: The Mongrel
item.itunes:subtitle: The Mongrel howls from his new podcasting digs at thedial.net
item.itunes:summary: This week, still no publishing industry news, but the show does feature Boston-based music with gigs within the next week or so in or near Boston.
item.description: The Mongrel howls from his new podcasting digs at thedial.net. This is the second official podcast of The Mongrel's Howl. Featured music: Pure Fiction--"Closer", Ara Vora--"This Is Not a Western", James Christensen--"The Hard Thing" Isaac's Dream--"Still Unbreakable", Peter Rice--"(Don't You) Fall For a Fool"
item.itunes:keywords: Boston, Massachusetts, indie, music, indy, musicians, music, record, label, bands, "Pure Fiction", "Ara Vora", "James Christensen", "Isaac's Dream", "Peter Rice",

channel.item:
Mon, December 05, 2005 - The Mongrel Howls Again! The Mongrel The Mongrel howls from his new podcasting digs at thedial.net This week, the show features Boston-based music. With the exception of the first and last artists, these are groups with gigs this weekend in or near Boston. The Mongrel howls from his new podcasting digs at thedial.net. This is the first official podcast of The Mongrel's Howl, a weekly Internet radio show about (mostly) publishing news and events in and around Boston. Featured music: Circe Link--"Bluebird Tattoo", The Bagboys--"That's Right! (I May Be Wrong)", Josh Lederman y Los Diablos--"Well The Days Go By", Medina Sod--"Thailand", The Dig Trio--"Hearts and Minds" My Podcast Alley feed! {pca-0fb5b6f5885aa3a6665152f7a73c4206}
http://www.thedial.net/howl/ http://www.thedial.net/howl/audio/howl_051205.mp3 Mon, 05 Dec 2005 19:00:00 GMT 26:14 Boston, Massachusetts, indie, music, indy, musicians, music, record, label, bands, "Circe Link", Bagboys, "Josh Lederman y Los Diablos", "Medina Sod", "Dig Trio"
